snippet: While lawmakers wrangle about how quickly immigrants should move on the path to citizenship, some Americans are questioning what such a path would mean in practice.
abstract: Path to American citizenship for 11 million immigrants living in country illegally has become central to debate on overhauling immigration system, but recent polls indicate many Americans have persistent doubts about what such a path would mean in practice; pending bill will include proposals to allow illegal immigrants to gain legal status and eventually become citizens.
lead_paragraph: While lawmakers wrangle about how quickly immigrants should move on the path to citizenship, some Americans are questioning what such a path would mean in practice.

headline.seo: In Immigration Reform, Path to Citizenship Divides and Confuses
headline.main: Path to Citizenship Divides Congress and, Polls Show, Confuses Country
headline.print_headline: Path to Citizenship Divides Congress and, Polls Show, Confuses Country
